meanings.definition: A person who makes predictions about the future.
meanings.sent1: The local weatherman, known as one of the prognosticators, always predicts rain accurately.
meanings.sent2: The group of prognosticators gathered to discuss their forecasts for the upcoming year.
meanings.sent3: The young child, pretending to be a prognosticator, predicted that they would get a puppy for their birthday.
meanings.sent4: The fortune teller's crystal ball revealed the shadowy figures of the prognosticators of fate.
meanings.sent5: In the fairy tale, the wise old owl was portrayed as the ultimate prognosticator of the forest.

meanings.definition: The act of predicting or foretelling future events.
meanings.sent1: The accuracy of the prognosticators' predictions surprised everyone at the event.
meanings.sent2: Prognosticators rely on various methods to make their predictions about the stock market.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a hilarious skit about a group of inept prognosticators trying to predict lottery numbers.
meanings.sent4: The ancient texts were believed to contain the secrets of the world's greatest prognosticators.
meanings.sent5: The crystal ball shimmered with the visions of the skilled prognosticators, revealing glimpses of the future.
